benchmark_details.name: UQ (Unsolved Questions)
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce UQ, a testbed of 500 challenging, diverse questions sourced from Stack Exchange, probing capabilities including reasoning, factuality, and browsing.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capabilities of AI models on unsolved questions that reflect real-world challenges and have not been definitively answered by human experts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation may not encompass all unsolved questions in a variety of domains as it primarily utilizes sources from Stack Exchange.

data.source: Curated from Stack Exchange using a multi-stage filtering pipeline involving rule-based, LLM-based, and human review filtering stages.
data.annotation: Filtered and verified through rule-based methods, LLM evaluations, and human reviews.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of AI models on the UQ dataset, including evaluation metrics established by LLM validators and subsequent human reviews.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate strong performance on difficult unsolved questions reflective of real-world tasks; low scores indicate challenges remaining in modeling such questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial human evaluations identified that top-performing models passed validation on only 15% of questions.
methodology.validation: The benchmark allows continuous updates and validations through community engagement and feedback.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of demographic factors is not explicitly provided but is a consideration during question selection.
harm: Potential reinforcement of existing biases in AI responses through unsolved, sensitive questions

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is sourced from Stack Exchange, subject to CC BY-SA licensing requirements.
